DM [BN] BOT 04-05-2023 14:22
ADVENTURE: The Consecration of St. Andral's Church *Recent events in Vallaki have been troubling, to say the least. Ghouls, Ghasts, Zombies and Skeletons assaulting the town square. An abyssal chicken was spotted. Rumors of cultists performing sacrifices in basements and abandoned sawmills outside of town. But people can still take comfort in the Church of St. Andral. Those who still believe in the Morninglord find solace there, under the pastoral care of Father Petrovich. They believe it a holy place, a consecrated place. A safe place. Father Petrovich seems worried however. He seeks one of you out, asking for for help with a small problem..*
BN [Fuji¬π‚Å¥|Moondrop‚Å∏|BJ‚Å∂]-4 has pinned a message to this channel
DM [BN] BOT 04-05-2023 18:52
Over the last day, the rumor of a single abyssal chicken has grown into sightings of an entire flock of abyssal demon chickens. And while it may sound silly, it's not. There have definitely been injuries and rumors of deaths. Undead somehow rose within the city and assaulted the Burgomaster's mansion and the town square no more than a week ago. More dead. The Baron held his latest festival anyway, promising "All Will Be Well." But all is not well. The festival did little to raise spirits. As cursed as the lands of Barovia are, the town of Vallaki was meant to be a safe space. And it no longer feels safe. It feels like the walls are no longer enough, and the Burgomaster (Baron Vargas Vallakovich)'s ability to protect them is slipping. Rumors have started to spread about the Baron. Someone says they saw flashes of light, green and sickly, like some sort of eldritch magic, from one of the upstairs windows of the Baron's mansion. And so, the people of Vallaki are on edge. Unsettled. And historically, when all is not well, people are unfomfortable, or have sins to confess, the Church of St Andral, devoted to the Morninglord, lead by Father Lucian Petrovich, is a place of solace.

Ahmonet, who has been to the church before, receives a note delivered by a young urchin, or perhaps an orphan from the orphanage next door to the church. For a copper, they will happy deliver messages throughout town. The note reads:
Ahmonet - I know you are a person of honor, integrity, and faith. I have need of your aid, urgently. Please bring those whom you trust to aid you. /s/ Father Petrovich of the Church of St. Andral.

DM [BN] BOT 05-05-2023 13:49
The air is cold a dreary, as always in Barovia. The mists are thick this morning. Candles light the church. The doors are closed to keep the thick mists away. As you open a door, you see several villagers inside. Off to one side, on pews near the back, an entire family. Several adults, a couple young children, and a sullen looking teenager. The parents are trying to keep the children entertained while not being too loud. They're obvious weary. Closer to the front of the church is a man, a single man. You see Father Petrovich speaking with the man, softly, both sitting on the pews. Father Petrovich glances up to you at the door from across the large interior space of the church, but then turn his attention back to the man. Up front, near the altar, is a young boy, perhaps ten years old. He seems to be setting up new candles (unlit).

Father Petrovich BOT 08-05-2023 13:06
Father Petrovich is getting on in years, but he's a man with a duty. He has deep, sunken, tired eyes from years of tending to the people of Vallaki. "Anyone can serve the Morninglord, doing good deeds in his name. I could baptize you to the Faith today, if you so chose!" He's serious, but there's a hint of light-heartedness in his words as well. You're not the first group of adventurers he's encountered through the years, with their outside views and strange ways. He knows full well y'all wouldn't accept.
Father Petrovich BOT 08-05-2023 13:33
"But no, that's not why I've asked you here. I've asked you here because things are dire and I have nowhere else to turn. The town has been under assault, both from undead and now demonic chickens! And the church has always been a safe haven, but.. that's where our problems lie." He pauses, collecting his thoughts. "You are going to be the only people who knows this. The bones of St. Andral are enshrined here, beneath the altar. Or they were. They were what consecrated the church, made it a safe haven. And they've recently gone missing. I don't know when, but as of two nights ago, I noticed the altar was disturbed. And in the crypt beneath the altar, they're now gone." He pushes on, raising a hand to stop you if you attempt to interrupt. "I say you are the only to know. That's not quite true. I mentioned them to Yeska, the altar boy, over a month ago to put the fearful boy at ease. I asked Yeska if he told anyone else about the bones. The boy nodded but wouldn't divulge a name. I'm at a loss, but we must recover those bones. Please, be gentle with the boy if you can, but we must recover those bones!"

The orphanage stands as a two-story structure, with a small, overgrown garden at the front. The front gate creaks on its hinges as you push it open, revealing a pathway leading to the entrance.
